snippet: Thailand’s military junta extended its rule by at least seven months when its reform council voted against a constitution written by its own drafting committee.
abstract: Thailand National Reform Council votes down proposed constitution, ensuring continued rule by military junta into 2016; many in country have become cynical about government and are calling process political theater and predicting indefinite military rule.
lead_paragraph: Thailand’s military junta extended its rule by at least seven months when its reform council voted against a constitution written by its own drafting committee.

headline.main: Thailand’s Military Junta Rejects Draft Constitution
headline.print_headline: Thailand’s Military Junta Extends Its Rule as Its Council Rejects a Draft Constitution
